page.title: 03'The Old Mill house'.
page.content: A typical old house of this area. 415 years old, carefully renovated by the present owners preserving the original building which is made of brick, wattle and daub on a timber frame. The upstairs floors are uneven because the frame and beams warped over the years, it is roofed with original Horsham stone slates. The timber frame is visible. Inside the house a section of wattle and daub was framed and glazed to preserve it. The woodwork has been treated for worm and rot, and renewed in places. Piped water, modern sanitation, new kitchen, central heating replace old pumps, earth closets, spit roasting, but open fireplaces are preserved and used. Many similar old Sussex houses have been rescued and modernised to make comfortable homes.
